definition: to overtake/to catch up with/to hurry/to rush/to try to catch (the bus etc)/to drive (cattle etc) forward/to drive (sb) away/to avail oneself of (an opportunity)/until
to exceed/to overtake/to surpass/to transcend/to pass/to cross/ultra-/super-

sentences.english: Fire Thunder to play a maximum power of catching up after school kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 发挥上限的烈火雷霆学了后威力赶超菜刀。

sentences.english: The key to the catching-up of the developing country is to nurture factors and enhance technical capability.
sentences.chinese: 后发技术赶超的关键就是培育要素，提升技术能力。

sentences.english: Because we Chinese are catching-up with America.
sentences.chinese: 因为我们中国人正在赶超美国。

sentences.english: The battle to catch Google grows harder by the day.
sentences.chinese: 赶超谷歌的战役难度与日剧增。

sentences.english: Last year, China surpassed India to send the most students to the US.
sentences.chinese: 去年，中国赶超印度成为留美学生最多的国家。

sentences.english: Learn from the advanced, then we may have been able to outrank them.
sentences.chinese: 学习先进，才有可能赶超先进。

sentences.english: Our heroes happen upon a Bug Pokémon Catching Contest.
sentences.chinese: 我们的英雄时发生错误神奇宝贝赶超竞赛。

sentences.english: A: It is said that your company has caught up with and even surpassed some world-famous enterprises.
sentences.chinese: 听说您的公司在实力上已经赶超了一些世界知名企业。

sentences.english: After the start, Aaron Kwok again overtook Sean He at the first lap.
sentences.chinese: 郭富城在第一圈赶超杆位的何贤磊。

sentences.english: Finishing the year ahead of Raul in the European goalscorers chart?
sentences.chinese: 年底时赶超劳尔排在欧战射手榜最前面？

definition: to try hard to catch up
lit. late-comer lives above (idiom); the up-and-coming youngster outstrips the older generation/the pupil surpasses the master
to catch up vigorously/to set off in hot pursuit
to pursue/to chase after/to accelerate/to catch up with/to overtake
to run neck and neck/to keep pace with/to keep abreast of/on a par with one another
to advance by leaps and bounds
a long way in front/to lead by a wide margin
to catch up with England and surpass the USA (economic goal)
to overtake on a bend (driving)/(fig.) taking opportunity of tight corners to make swift progress (economy etc)
to rise abruptly (to a towering position)/to tower over/to spring up/to emerge suddenly/the emergence (e.g. of a power)
lit. to see only the other rider's dust and have no hope of catching up (idiom)/to be far inferior
